data.title: Keep pending pane hotkey
data.body:
This is a feature suggestion/request: I would like a hotkey to keep the (currently focused?) pending pane.
It's really cumbersome to always double click and we programmers like hotkeys :) so why is there none for this?

I might even be able to add this myself in a pull request, if given some direction to the current double click logic.

data.title: Git Tab - Open preview of diff in same tab
data.body:
**The problem:**
At this time, if you have a lot of changes across many files and you want to preview the changes, every diff opens in a separate tab which leads to a lot of open tabs.

**My feature request:**
Option to open all git diffs in one and the same tab.

[ ] Put configuration option in module.
[ ] Open diff view in same tab by default.
[ ] Ctrl + Click opens diff in separate tab.

data.title: Restore the fs.existsSync guard in Config
data.body:
season 6.0.0's `CSON.writeFileSync` method didn't have a third "options" argument, so if this code is executed with an old version of season, it will _always_ unconditionally wipe the config. This can happen if, for example, you open Atom in developer mode after doing a `git pull` in your Atom directory but before running a `script/build` to update the dependencies.

/cc @BinaryMuse @damieng @kuychaco

data.title: Old versions not removed on upgrade (Windows)
data.body:
So I'm probably not following the bug report concept (sorry not a developer or much of it person)... but i need to send this to developers..

The issue is how ATOM is filling up my windows 10 hard drive..

I was wondering recently why my HD was beginning to fill up. after looking at all the issues i found one strange folder
~/AppData/Local/atom/ 
was at almost 5.5GB of space.. after exploring it a bit i found out that old version of ATOM are not being cleared out properly, this included old bugs... and packages. about 450MB per each version you upgrade.

Thank You and please correct this issue.

Thank You
Tom

data.title: Git diff view shows "File has no contents" for modified files
data.body: Firstly, thank you for such an amazing project - I've just swapped to Atom and other than this issue it's been a great experience :) ### Prerequisites * [X] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following: * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/ * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages ### Description When using Atom and viewing a modified file in Git, the editor always shows "File has no contents". It correctly shows for new files but not for deleted or modified files. I have tried with Atom Beta and Atom both in and out of safe mode. The project I am working in has a `.git` folder in the root. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Open a git based project in Atom. 2. Edit an existing file. 3. Bring up the git pane. 4. Click on a modified file to view it. **Expected behavior:** The editor shows the git diff. **Actual behavior:** The editor shows "File has no contents" (see screenshot) **Reproduces how often:** 100% of the time, across two machines. I have never been able to get this to work. ### Versions ``` atom --version Atom : 1.20.0 Electron: 1.6.9 Chrome : 56.0.2924.87 Node : 7.4.0 apm --version apm 1.18.4 npm 3.10.10 node 6.9.5 x64 python 2.7.13 git 2.13.4 ``` I am on OS X 10.12.6. I have also tried a completely fresh install.

data.title: Deprecation false-positive: Function.extractParams is deprecated
data.body:
### Description

`TextEditor.addCursorAtBufferPosition(pos, { autoscroll: false })` triggers the following deprecation warning:

> Assigning custom properties to a marker when creating/copying it is
deprecated. Please, consider storing the custom properties you need in
some other object in your package, keyed by the marker's id property.

This is a false positive, since `autoscroll` is not a marker property, but rather an option for `addCursorAtBufferPosition` itself.

I believe https://github.com/atom/atom/commit/b362f746f8fb21d9850f02ca82cc50e90e126d38 is at fault.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. run `atom.workspace.getActiveTextEditor().addCursorAtBufferPosition([0,0], { autoscroll: false })` in dev. console.
2. Open Deprecation Cop

**Expected behavior:** No deprecations

**Actual behavior:** 1 deprecation in atom core:
> atom core (1 deprecation)
> 
> Assigning custom properties to a marker when creating/copying it is deprecated. Please, consider storing the custom properties you need in some other object in your package, keyed by the marker's id property.
```
Function.extractParams - <embedded>:127825:20
MarkerLayer.markPosition - <embedded>:73406:30
DisplayMarkerLayer.markBufferPosition - <embedded>:128445:58
TextEditor.addCursorAtBufferPosition - <embedded>:4226:40
<unknown> - :1:38
```

**Reproduces how often:** 100%

### Versions

Tested on Atom 1.20. I believe all versions since 1.19.0-beta0 are affected.

### Additional Information

Initially reported at https://github.com/atom-haskell/ide-haskell/issues/212

Related: https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/149 (PR that introduced deprecation message in question)

data.title: disk and path is missing the "\" separator for network mounted drives on Win7
data.body:
### Description
Atom path returned by:
`atom.workspace.getActiveTextEditor().getPath()`
is missing separator `\` between disk and directory.

### Steps to Reproduce
1. Export some disk by Samba etc.
2. Mount the network drive to windows.
3. Open the file from mounted drive by Atom.
4. Open Developer tools console and run:
`atom.workspace.getActiveTextEditor().getPath()`

**Expected behavior:** [What you expect to happen]
The valid file path should be returned: 
`"N:\frontend\Templates\TemplatesList.jsx"`

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happens]
The actual path returned is missing `\` separator between DiskDrive and Directory:
`"N:frontend\Templates\TemplatesList.jsx"`

### Versions
Windows 7 x64
Atom version: 1.20.0-beta7

### Additional Information
Originally the problem was experienced for linter-eslint and reported here:
https://github.com/AtomLinter/linter-eslint/issues/1011

The same is not observed for local drives.

I'm observing some other issues like unable to rename/delete files.

data.title: Backport config improvements to 1.20
data.body:
Backport the Config changes from #15440 to stable to deal with the race conditions #14909.

This will require some additional work because the `watchPath` API wasn't introduced until 1.21, so I'll need to backport the stat-polling logic from nsfw.

/cc @kuychaco who did most of the original PR
/cc @ungb @rsese @iolsen for visibility into progress on this

data.title: Update Atom from macOS fails
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

Unable to update Atom from within the application using the squirrel icon.
 
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open Atom
2. Notice that the blue squirrel appeared
3. Clicked on it, opening the `About` tab
4. It says that a new version is ready
5. Click on `Restart and install`

**Expected behavior:** Atom should close, updated and reopen

**Actual behavior:** Atom closes and then nothing.

**Reproduces how often:** Always.

### Versions

```
# atom --version
Atom    : 1.19.7
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0
```

```
# apm --version
apm  1.18.4
npm  3.10.10
node 6.9.5 x64
python 3.6.2
git 2.13.4
```

Running on macOS 10.12.6

### Additional Information

As suggested by @lee-dohm in https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13804#issuecomment-328403955 I followed the instruction on [FAQ](https://discuss.atom.io/t/i-am-unable-to-update-to-the-latest-version-of-atom-on-macos-how-do-i-fix-this/40054).

These two directories are set OK:

- `/Applications/Atom.app/`
- `~/Library/Caches/com.github.atom.ShipIt`

However, this one: `~/Library/Application Support/com.github.atom.ShipIt` doesn't exists on my machine.

data.title: Cursor focusses background when switching from ⌘+P to ⌘+⇧+P
data.body:
### Prerequisites

* [x] Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following:
    * Reproduced the problem in Safe Mode: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#using-safe-mode
    * Followed all applicable steps in the debugging guide: http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/
    * Checked the FAQs on the message board for common solutions: https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq
    * Checked that your issue isn't already filed: https://github.com/issues?utf8=✓&q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom
    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

Cursor jump

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Use ⌘+P (or ⌘+T, doesn't matter) to bring up the file navigation
2. Use ⌘+⇧+P to bring up the commands menu
3. Start typing

**Expected behavior:**

I type in the command and the list is fuzzy searched by what I've typed.

**Actual behavior:**

The list is not searched, because it has lost focus. Instead the editor in the background is focussed and receives my input.

Maybe this GIF helps to illustrate the problem a bit: 
![atom-focus-bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82050/30371495-0e0f941a-987b-11e7-9725-1d3ee3477962.gif)


**Reproduces how often:** 100%

### Versions

`atom --version`:

Atom    : 1.20.0
Electron: 1.6.9
Chrome  : 56.0.2924.87
Node    : 7.4.0

`apm --version`:

apm  1.18.4
npm  3.10.10
node 6.9.5 x64
python 2.7.10
git 2.14.

OSX 10.12.6

### Additional Information

Thanks all involved for your hard work, I use Atom daily and can't wait for the IDE to land with the next release :)

data.title: [Enhancement] Toggle pane group shortcuts
data.body:
Recently Atom introduced the ability to toggle "groups" of panes with the popover icons: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/621277/30359934-8dd6c716-9891-11e7-96f5-463312f8e119.png)

It would be ideal to be able to assign a keyboard shortcut to do this.

For example in my current setup, on the left pane group I have the `Project`, `Git` and `Outline View` panes. To show/hide this group of panes, I need to either click the button or use the toggle hotkey for one of the panes inside it (which also activates that pane inside the group). It would be better if I could define a single keyboard shortcut to toggle the group, regardless of what panes are inside it.

data.body:

    * Checked that there is not already an Atom package that provides the described functionality: https://atom.io/packages

### Description

I was developing a package and I need to put a breakpoint to check a variable's value. This breakpoint is in a method which is invoked by the `active` method. When I reload the page, it paused at the breakpoint, then I press `Step over next function call`, the editor crashed.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Get a package.
2. Open devTool, find the package's source file.
3. Put a breakpoint in the active method.
4. Reload the page.

**Expected behavior:** Editor not crash

**Actual behavior:** Editor crashed

**Reproduces how often:** 100%

node 6.9.5 x64
